definition: drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
the chirping of birds or insects/noise/clamor/buzzing/disturbance

sentences.english: Don't get caught up in their marketing noise.
sentences.chinese: 不要被他们的营销鼓噪所迷惑。

sentences.english: The crowd gave the visiting politician quite a barracking .
sentences.chinese: 群众对这位来访的政客鼓噪抗议。

sentences.english: The crowd clamored that the suspect (should) be sentenced to death.
sentences.chinese: 群众鼓噪，要求将嫌疑犯处以死刑。

sentences.english: The soldiers are rising in a hubub.
All the buzz lately is that the Obama administration is "antibusiness."
sentences.chinese: 最近的所有鼓噪都是说奥巴马政府是“反企业的”。

sentences.english: By dawn Lord Guan and his commanders, waving flags and beating drums, were bearing down in large ships.
sentences.chinese: 比及平明，关公及众将皆摇旗鼓噪，乘大船而来。

definition: to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
to shout an order or command
to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
to shout loudly/to raise a cry/to yell
